answers.answer: Hello,Few causes for your symptoms would include dehydration, micronutrient deficiency, stress, hormonal/ endocrine disturbances etc. I would suggest consulting your primary care physician if you could try some mild anti-spasmodic medication and see if these seem to help. Other things that may be helpful are regular exercise (with warm up and cool down sessions), weight loss if overweight, intake of a balanced diet with plenty of fruits and vegetables.It is very difficult to precisely confirm a diagnosis without examination and investigations and the answer is based on the medical information provided. For exact diagnosis, you are requested to consult your doctor. I sincerely hope that helps. Take care and please do keep me posted on how you are doing.

question: I get charlie horses in my intestines or the stomache area. In my ribs ad legs also feet. It is very painful. I try and do streching exercises with over  fifty in a chair but have to quit right away do to cramps. What causes this? What can I do to make it go away?I have diabetes type 2 highBP high colesterol hepititis B,C  obese, COPD I dont know if any of these deseases causes this bu please tell me what this could be.
title: Charlie horses
